action.action-desc: Mrs. Houchin (for herself, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Westerman, Mr. Mrvan, and Mr. Neguse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act to improve provisions relating to dyslexia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the 21st Century Dyslexia Act.

subsection.text: Section 602 of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1401) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)(A), by striking or specific learning disabilities and inserting specific learning disabilities, or dyslexia;
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

The term dyslexia means an unexpected difficulty in reading for an individual who has the intelligence to be a much better reader, most commonly caused by a difficulty in the phonological processing (the appreciation of the individual sounds of spoken language), which affects the ability of an individual to speak, read, and spell.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking dyslexia,; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking or of environmental and all that follows and inserting or dyslexia.

subsection.text: The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is amended by inserting after section 608 (20 U.S.C. 1407) the following:

section.text: In determining eligibility for, or providing, an accommodation or service under this title, a local educational agency or other agency shall provide equal access, to the accommodation or service, to all eligible children, including eligible children who are—

paragraph.text: children from families with low socioeconomic status; and
children who are limited English proficient.
